description: Latin admixtūra, from admixtus, past participle of admisceō (“to mix in”), from misceō (“to mix”). Analyzable as ad- +‎ mixture.

definitionGroups.group: An instance of admixing, a mixing in of something.

entries.meaning: A mixing-in of a biologically or genetically differentiated group to an established stock.
(epilepsy) a mixture composed of entities retaining their individual properties.
examples: Background EEG demonstrates an admixture of theta and delta waves.
